column4: i have mounted my harddrive. chrooted it.. how do i set it up so that i can launch gui apps? Text apps run fine. I get 'cannot open display:unset' when i try to run gui apps.
i don't know wheter X works in chroot, but try export DISPLAY="localhost:0"
that didnt seem to help
i guess it's just not possible...
:( .. news i dont want to hear
i want to lanch aptoncd so i can backup the apps that i have installed my harddrive wont boot any longer.. i can mount it though. and its making sounds (its dying)
hmmm you can see if there are any packages left in /var/apt/cache
yeah... not much is there.. i think
checking now
75 packages.. and must are just lib stuff..
there is some list of installed software, second, i'll look where it should be
you can use this to write out a list of installed software: "dpkg --get-selections > <somefile>"
is there any way that i can differentiate the apps that were installed on ubuntu by default versus the apps that I installed..
well you could compare it with the list on the livecd , or on a fresh install
hmmm.. good point
have you ever used aptoncd... ?? it just smart enough to know the apps that we instaled by me.. (*wonders how it works*)
never even heard of it
you can have a look in the manpage of dpkg
http://aptoncd.sourceforge.net/
ok i will do that.. was there just a second ago
seemingly nothing useful in the man pages dpkg
then i would try comparing them... diff should be able to cope with that
ok.. there maybe something in the .desktop files that can help me too.. I am going to give that a looksee
